description: The main schema for the entire workflow. It defines the structure of a workflow, including its steps, connections, and global state. A workflow must have exactly one 'begin' step and at most one 'end' step.

$schema.description: The JSON schema version used for validation.

id.description: A unique identifier for the workflow.

name.description: A human-readable name for the workflow.

version.description: The version of the workflow definition.

globalStateSchema.description: A JSON schema that defines the structure of the global state.

globalState.description: The initial global state of the workflow.

steps.description: An array of steps that make up the workflow.

anyOf.description: Schema for a 'task' step in the workflow. This represents a unit of work to be performed.

id.description: A unique identifier for the step.

name.description: A human-readable name for the step.

paramsSchema.description: A JSON schema that defines the parameters for the step.

metadata.description: An object for storing any additional or custom information for the step. Use this for data not covered by the standard fields.

anyOf.description: Schema for a decision step in the workflow. This type of step is used to control the flow by branching to different steps based on conditions defined in the outgoing connections.

id.description: A unique identifier for the step.

name.description: A human-readable name for the step.

paramsSchema.description: A JSON schema that defines the parameters for the step. This field should not be used for 'decision' steps.

params.description: The parameters for the step. This field should not be used for 'decision' steps.

metadata.description: An object for storing any additional or custom information for the step. Use this for data not covered by the standard fields.

anyOf.description: Schema for a 'begin' step in the workflow. This is the starting point of the workflow.

id.description: A unique identifier for the step.

name.description: A human-readable name for the step.

paramsSchema.description: A JSON schema that defines the parameters for the step. This field should not be used for 'begin' steps.

params.description: The parameters for the step. This field should not be used for 'begin' steps.

metadata.description: An object for storing any additional or custom information for the step. Use this for data not covered by the standard fields.

anyOf.description: Schema for an 'end' step in the workflow. This is a terminal point of the workflow.

id.description: A unique identifier for the step.

name.description: A human-readable name for the step.

paramsSchema.description: A JSON schema that defines the parameters for the step. This field should not be used for 'end' steps.

params.description: The parameters for the step. This field should not be used for 'end' steps.

metadata.description: An object for storing any additional or custom information for the step. Use this for data not covered by the standard fields.

connections.description: An array of connections between the steps.

id.description: A unique identifier for the connection.

sourceStepId.description: The ID of the source step.

targetStepId.description: The ID of the target step.

condition.description: A condition that must be met for this connection to be taken.

metadata.description: An object for storing any additional or custom information for the workflow. Use this for data not covered by the standard fields.

type.description: The data type of the schema.

properties.description: The properties of an object schema.

items.description: The schema for items in an array.
